metadata.title: CVE-2019-18610 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in manager.c in Sangoma Asterisk through 13.x, 16.x, 17.x and Certified Asterisk 13.21 through 13.21-cert4. A remote authenticated Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI) user without system authorization could use a specially crafted Originate AMI request to execute arbitrary system commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-18610` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-config - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-dahdi - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mobile - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-modules - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mp3 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-mysql - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-tests - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
asterisk-vpb - 1:16.10.0~dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:16.10.0~dfsg-1').
